metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4342 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
ext/phar/phar_object.c in PHP before 5.5.32, 5.6.x before 5.6.18, and 7.x before 7.0.3 mishandles zero-length uncompressed data, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap memory corruption) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted (1) TAR, (2) ZIP, or (3) PHAR archive.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4342` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.0 - 7.0.4-7ubuntu2
libphp7.0-embed - 7.0.4-7ubuntu2
php7.0 - 7.0.4-7ubuntu2
php7.0-bcmath - 7.0.4-7ubuntu2
php7.0-bz2 - 7.0.4-7ubuntu2

No subscription required

criterions.comment: php7.0 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.0.4-7ubuntu2').
